result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany K. Durrant was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
**Amended 1/12/16 to indicate defendant to pay restitution ordered in Amended JOC in 15CF95.
Concurrent with: with 15CF95 and 15CF109.

superMiscConds.notes:
Defendant shall have no contact with any known drug dealers or users.
Defendant shall not possess any illegal substances or drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961.
Defendant shall not be on any premises where she has cause to believe such contraband may be present.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall possess prescriptions only with a valid prescription and take in the manner and method as prescribed by her physician.
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from only 1 pharmacy and within 48 hours, defendant to report any medical changes to her Agent.
Defendant shall receive Alcohol and other Drug Assessment from Waupaca County DHHS or other licensed agency as determined by Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
